sentences.english: Our children, of course, are priceless.
sentences.chinese: 我們的孩子當然是無價之寶。

sentences.english: Little boy as I was before, Mon and Dad considered me as their most valuable treasure.
sentences.chinese: 以前，是少不更事的小男孩，父母心中的無價之寶。

sentences.english: Your time is priceless. Are you treating it that way?
sentences.chinese: 你是時間是無價之寶，你是這樣看待它麼？

sentences.english: That level of technique and desire is precious.
sentences.chinese: 魯尼這般水平的技術和意志是無價之寶。

sentences.english: The victorious army despoiled the city of many priceless treasures.
sentences.chinese: 戰勝的軍隊搶奪了那城市的許多無價之寶。

sentences.english: He appreciates the valuable gift of life.
sentences.chinese: 他感激生命這一無價之寶。

sentences.english: But Scott's narrative shows that an interesting life is a priceless thing.
sentences.chinese: 但是斯科特的講述表明有趣的生活纔是無價之寶。

sentences.english: Even before the discovery of these fragments the Book of Ecclesiasticus was regarded as a unique document of priceless value;
sentences.chinese: 希伯來版沒有發現前，此書已經是獨特的無價之寶。

sentences.english: This is the priceless treasure Chinese people won through the baptism of thousands of years of blood and fire.
sentences.chinese: 這是中國人經過幾千年血與火的洗禮得到的無價之寶。

definition: after hard work and numerous revisions (idiom)/the vicissitudes of life
to break a code/to crack a riddle/to solve an enigma/a breakthrough
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
with a will, you can achieve anything (idiom); cf 精誠所至，金石為開|精诚所至，金石为开[jing1 cheng2 suo3 zhi4 , jin1 shi2 wei4 kai1]
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
in the depth of one's soul
proficiency in a particular field (idiom)/skill in a specialized area (idiom)
to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
